alert.note: Alert for Kent; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Talbot, southwestern Queen Anne`s and western Kent Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Londontowne, or over Mayo, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Centerville, Talbot, Centreville, Rock Hall, St. Michaels, Old Town, Grasonville, Starr, Stevensville, Skipton, Copperville, Langford, Chester, Overton, Wye Mills, Cordova, Queenstown and Stevensville South. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
